fullProgramDescription: The Design | Media Arts program at UCLA focuses on the study and application of design principles, media technologies, and artistic practices. The program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive education in the creative and technical aspects of media arts, preparing them for careers in fields such as game design, interactive media, animation, and visual effects.
shortProgramDescription: The Design | Media Arts B.A. program at UCLA provides students with a comprehensive education in design principles, media technologies, and artistic practices, preparing them for careers in media arts.
classHighlights: The program includes foundational courses in design, media arts, and art history, providing students with a solid understanding of the principles and practices of the field.
Students learn about various media technologies, including digital image making, digital video, and interactive media, and apply these skills in creative projects.
Courses in design theory and criticism, as well as art history, provide students with a deeper understanding of the cultural and historical contexts of media arts.
Students can explore various electives in areas such as game design, animation, and visual effects, allowing them to tailor their education to their specific interests and career goals.
learningOutcomes: Demonstrate proficiency in a range of media arts technologies and techniques.
Apply design principles and artistic practices to create effective media artworks.
Understand the cultural and historical contexts of media arts.
Develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills in the creation of media artworks.
Communicate ideas and concepts effectively through written and oral presentations.
additionalInformation: Students in the Design | Media Arts program are encouraged to participate in internships, study abroad programs, and other experiential learning opportunities to enhance their education and career prospects.
